definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

pinyin: wai4 guo2 ren2 ju1 zhu4 zheng4 ming2

sentences.english: To qualify for permanent residency, applicants must hold a Shanghai Residency Card and have lived in the city for at least seven years.
sentences.chinese: 申请落户者必须持有上海市居住证满7年。

sentences.english: She is grant a residence permit for one year.
sentences.chinese: 她被给予一张为期一年的居住证。

sentences.english: The Certificate of Work and Residence in Beijing shall be valid for two years.
sentences.chinese: 《北京市工作居住证》有效期限为两年。

sentences.english: Foreign governments want to sell them passports and residence cards.
sentences.chinese: 外国政府想向他们兜售护照和居住证。

sentences.english: Year residence permit for the conditions is to look at your work contract is a few years.
sentences.chinese: 申请的居住证年份条件就是看你的工作合同是几年。

definition: population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
to renew a certificate (ID card etc)/to leave an ID at the desk to gain entrance
social insurance/abbr. for 社會保險|社会保险

pinyin: Chu1 ru4 Jing4 Guan3 li3 ju2

definition: Mainland Travel Permit for Taiwan Residents/Taiwan Compatriot Entry Permit/abbr. for 台灣居民來往大陸通行證|台湾居民来往大陆通行证[Tai2 wan1 Ju1 min2 Lai2 wang3 Da4 lu4 Tong1 xing2 zheng4]
